Key Match Events: Ja Morant successfully bucketed a 360-degree mid-air spin to help the Grizzlies go up 45-41 in the second quarter.
Morant later pulled off another 360-degree shot later in the game to leave fans spellbound.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite Morant's pyrotechnics, the Grizzlies ended up losing 106-104 as the Nets pulled off a close win.
Ja Morant off to a solid start to his season with the Grizzlies
The Memphis Grizzlies' close loss pushes them to 4-4 and 10th in the standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Morant ended his evening with 25 points, nine rebounds, and five assists.
Rookie center Zach Edey had a field day with 25 points and 12 rebounds.
Jaren Jackson Jr. had 15 points to show for it.
Dennis Schroder and Cam Johnson led the Nets with 20 points each.
Dorian Finney-Smith and Cam Thomas chipped in with 17 and 13 points respectively.
